content:
I don’t have personal experience, but i can point out some historical landmarks that are considered must-see in savoy:

1. château de chambéry: located in the heart of chambéry, it is one of the most recognizable landmarks in savoy. it was the residence of the dukes of savoy from the 13th to the 16th century. 2. abbaye d'hautecombe: this abbey is located on the shores of lake bourget, founded in the 12th century, and it is a masterpiece of gothic art. it was also the burial site of the dukes of savoy until the 19th century. 3. vanoise national park: located in the french alps, it is one of the oldest national parks in france. it offers visitors breathtaking views of the mountains and is home to various species of wildlife. 4. fort de la bastille: located in grenoble, it was built in the 19th century and served as a strategic defense point during the wars between france and austria. it is accessible by a cable car that offers a panoramic view of the city. 5. les aiguilles d'arves: a group of three spectacular peaks in the french alps, which are among the most photogenic and famous natural landmarks in savoy. these are just a few examples of historical landmarks in savoy, but there are many more worth exploring.
